alert.note: Alert for Bucks (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 10:04PM EST until January 10 at 5:42PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Neshaminy Creek At Langhorne affecting Bucks County. For the Neshaminy Creek...including Langhorne...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Neshaminy Creek at Langhorne. * WHEN...From this evening to tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Water begins to overflow the lowest banks, on both sides of the creek, into adjacent wooded areas. At 9.0 feet, Flooding begins on Bridle Drive in Middletown Township. At 10.5 feet, Route 413, near Bridgeton Pike in Middletown Township, is subject to closures due to flooding. At 12.0 feet, Widespread flooding occurs on Bridle Drive in Middletown Township. The road becomes impassable. At 13.0 feet, Periwinkle Avenue in Middletown Township begins to flood. Flooding in also possible further downstream in the Croyden Section of Bristol Township, especially when the Delaware River tides are high. At 14.0 feet, Residential properties are flooded on Bridle Drive in Middletown Township. Flooding also occurs on Business US 1 in Middletown Township near Rising Sun Avenue. Flooding is also possible further downstream in the Croydon Section of Bristol Township, especially when the Delaware River tides are high. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 9.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.1 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.1 feet on 01/26/1978. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (1 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Stg Time Date Neshaminy Creek Langhorne 9.0 9.3 Tue 9 pm 5.3 3.5 13.1 7am 1/10 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 1015 AM EST.
